definitions: act of saving from sin, error, or evil through sacrifice or payment
process of repaying a bond or loan or exchanging something for its value
deliverance from sin and its consequences through divine grace
examples: The story tells of personal redemption through acts of kindness
His redemption came after years of struggling with addiction
The bond redemption date is scheduled for next December
Early redemption of the mortgage saved them thousands in interest
They believed in redemption through faith and good works
The sermon focused on redemption and spiritual transformation

definitions: movement of employees or military personnel to different positions or locations
reallocation of resources or equipment to new purposes or areas
examples: The company announced redeployment of staff to regional offices
Military redeployment brought troops home from overseas bases
The redeployment of funds improved the project's efficiency
Equipment redeployment helped meet the increased production demands

definitions: process of demolishing and rebuilding areas, especially in cities
act of creating new versions of software or technical systems
examples: The waterfront redevelopment transformed the abandoned industrial area
Urban redevelopment plans included affordable housing and parks
The app underwent complete redevelopment to improve user experience
Software redevelopment addressed all the security vulnerabilities

definitions: late-night or overnight flight, typically crossing multiple time zones
photographic effect causing eyes to appear red in flash photography
cocktail made with beer and tomato juice or similar ingredients
examples: She took the redeye from Los Angeles to New York
Business travelers often book redeye flights to save time
The camera's redeye reduction feature improved their portraits
Digital editing removed the redeye from the family photo
He ordered a redeye to cure his morning hangover
The bartender mixed a perfect redeye with beer and clamato

definitions: person having naturally red or auburn-colored hair
North American diving duck with reddish-brown head plumage
examples: The redhead stood out in the crowd with her vibrant hair
Natural redheads comprise only two percent of the population
The redhead duck migrated south for the winter months
Hunters identified the redhead by its distinctive coloring

definitions: act of finding something that was lost or forgotten
process of recognizing value in something previously overlooked or abandoned
examples: The rediscovery of the ancient manuscript excited historians worldwide
Her rediscovery of the family recipe brought back memories
The band's rediscovery by younger audiences boosted their popularity
His rediscovery of classical music enriched his retirement years

definitions: transfer of income, wealth, or property from some individuals to others through social mechanisms
act of distributing something again or differently among a group
examples: Tax policies aimed at wealth redistribution sparked political debate
Income redistribution programs help reduce economic inequality
The redistribution of supplies ensured all departments had resources
Data redistribution improved the network's overall performance

definitions: working-class white person from rural southern United States
person perceived as having conservative, provincial, or bigoted attitudes
examples: The redneck proudly displayed his truck and hunting gear
Country music celebrates redneck culture and values
Critics dismissed him as a redneck with outdated views
The term redneck became a controversial stereotype

definitions: process of making something smaller in size, amount, or degree
act of losing weight through diet, exercise, or other methods
examples: Reducing waste became the company's environmental priority
The reducing agent caused the chemical reaction to proceed
Her reducing diet eliminated processed foods and sugars
The reducing program combined exercise with portion control

definitions: act or process of making something smaller or less in amount
chemical reaction involving gain of electrons or decrease in oxidation state
process of converting mathematical expressions to simpler forms
examples: Cost reduction measures saved the company millions annually
The reduction in staff affected department morale significantly
The reduction of iron ore produces pure metal
Chemical reduction requires an appropriate reducing agent
Fraction reduction makes calculations much easier to perform
The reduction of the equation revealed the solution

definitions: philosophical position that complex phenomena can be explained by simpler components
scientific approach analyzing complex systems through their constituent parts
examples: Critics argue that reductionism oversimplifies human behavior
Philosophical reductionism seeks fundamental explanations for everything
Scientific reductionism helped advance molecular biology significantly
The reductionism in physics reduces matter to particles

definitions: dismissal from employment because the position is no longer needed
state of being unnecessarily repetitive or superfluous in expression
inclusion of extra components for reliability in case of failure
examples: The factory closure resulted in hundreds of redundancies
She received a redundancy payment after twenty years service
The essay suffered from redundancy and poor organization
Editorial review eliminated redundancy from the manuscript
System redundancy ensures continuous operation during failures
The spacecraft had triple redundancy for critical systems

definitions: giant evergreen coniferous tree native to California coastal regions
durable reddish wood obtained from redwood trees used in construction
examples: The ancient redwood towered three hundred feet above them
California's redwood forests attract millions of visitors annually
They built the deck using weather-resistant redwood lumber
Redwood siding gave the house a natural rustic appearance

definitions: tall grass-like plant growing in wetlands and marshes
thin piece of cane or metal that vibrates to produce sound in instruments
dried plant stems used for thatching, basketry, or other crafts
examples: Reeds grew densely along the riverbank creating wildlife habitat
The marsh reed provided nesting sites for waterfowl
The clarinet reed needed replacement before the concert
Saxophone players often customize their reed for tone
Indigenous peoples wove reed baskets for storing grain
The cottage roof was thatched with locally harvested reed

definitions: ridge of rock, coral, or sand near the water surface
part of a sail that can be rolled or folded to reduce area
vein or lode of ore in mining
examples: The coral reef supported diverse marine life ecosystems
Snorkelers explored the reef searching for tropical fish
The sailors took a reef in the mainsail as winds increased
Learning to reef properly ensures safety in storms
Miners discovered a rich reef of gold-bearing quartz
The reef yielded high-grade ore for decades

definitions: refrigerated shipping container or truck for transporting perishables
slang term for a marijuana cigarette
short double-breasted jacket often worn by sailors
examples: The reefer maintained optimal temperature during cross-country transport
Fresh produce traveled in reefer containers to preserve quality
Police found a reefer in his jacket pocket
The term reefer became popularized in jazz culture
He wore a navy reefer over his uniform
The wool reefer provided warmth on deck

definitions: cylindrical device for winding and storing rope, wire, film, or thread
lively Scottish or Irish folk dance performed in groups
spool containing photographic film or magnetic tape
examples: The fishing reel smoothly released line as the fish ran
He wound the garden hose onto the reel for storage
The wedding guests danced a traditional Scottish reel
Musicians played reels and jigs throughout the evening
The projectionist loaded the film reel into the projector
Archivists carefully preserved the old movie reels

definitions: successful campaign to be elected again to the same political office
process of being chosen again for a position in an organization
examples: The president won reelection by a narrow margin
Her reelection campaign focused on economic achievements
The board chair sought reelection after a successful term
Union reelection procedures follow strict democratic guidelines

definitions: performance recreating a historical event with attention to period detail
reconstruction of a crime or incident for investigative purposes
examples: The Civil War reenactment attracted thousands of participants
Historical reenactment teaches history through immersive experience
Police staged a reenactment to understand the crime sequence
The documentary included a reenactment of the accident

definitions: spacecraft's return into Earth's atmosphere from space
act of entering again or returning to a previous state or activity
examples: The capsule's reentry generated intense heat from friction
Successful reentry required precise angle and speed calculations
His reentry into politics surprised former colleagues
The program assists prisoner reentry into society

definitions: process of examining and judging something again with fresh perspective
recalculation of worth, price, or importance of assets or policies
examples: The committee's reevaluation changed the project's direction completely
Personal reevaluation led her to change career paths
Property reevaluation increased the tax assessment significantly
Currency reevaluation affected international trade balances

definitions: informal term for referee in sports competitions
abbreviated form of reference in citations or documents
examples: The ref made a controversial call in overtime
Players argued with the ref about the penalty
See ref 12 for additional statistical data
The ref section lists all cited sources

definitions: official who enforces rules and makes decisions in sports competitions
academic who reviews papers or evaluates candidates for positions
person appointed to resolve disputes or oversee bankruptcy proceedings
examples: The referee showed a red card for the dangerous tackle
Professional referees undergo extensive training and fitness tests
She served as referee for several prestigious journals
The referee recommended publication with minor revisions
The court appointed a referee to mediate the settlement
The bankruptcy referee managed creditor claims fairly

definitions: act of serving as referee in sports matches or competitions
process of evaluating academic papers or professional credentials
examples: His refereeing career spanned twenty years in professional soccer
Consistent refereeing standards improve game fairness
The journal's refereeing process ensures publication quality
Anonymous refereeing prevents bias in academic evaluation

definitions: source of information cited to support statements or provide details
letter or statement recommending someone for a position
act of mentioning or alluding to something
examples: The research paper included fifty references to scientific studies
Check the reference section for complete citations
Her former employer provided an excellent reference
Most jobs require at least two professional references
The speech contained several references to historical events
His reference to the incident surprised everyone

definitions: direct vote by citizens on a specific proposal or constitutional amendment
process of referring a political question to the electorate for decision
examples: The referendum on independence divided the nation
Voters approved the referendum by a narrow margin
The referendum process requires significant public engagement
Constitutional changes often require a referendum

definitions: direction of a patient to a specialist for treatment
recommendation of a person or business for services
transfer of a case or matter to another authority
examples: The doctor wrote a referral to the cardiologist
Insurance requires a referral for specialist visits
Customer referrals generate significant new business
The referral bonus program rewards successful recommendations
The case referral went to the federal prosecutor
Social services made a referral to child protection

definitions: replacement or additional supply of something that was used up
act of filling something again after it has been emptied
examples: She picked up her prescription refill at the pharmacy
The coffee shop offers free refills on all beverages
The waiter brought a refill without being asked
Printer cartridge refills save money and reduce waste

definitions: process of making improvements by removing impurities or defects
quality of being sophisticated, polite, and having good taste
stage in processing where materials are purified or improved
examples: Product refinement continued through multiple design iterations
The refinement of her technique took years of practice
Her refinement and grace impressed everyone at the gala
The restaurant's refinement attracted an upscale clientele
Oil refinement produces various petroleum products
Sugar refinement removes impurities and creates white crystals

definitions: industrial facility where crude substances are purified and processed
place where materials undergo refinement to produce finished products
examples: The oil refinery processes millions of barrels daily
Safety regulations at the refinery are extremely strict
The sugar refinery converted raw cane into white sugar
Metal refineries extract pure elements from ore

definitions: industrial process of removing impurities from raw materials
act of making small improvements to achieve perfection
examples: Refining crude oil yields gasoline and other products
The refining process requires high temperatures and pressure
She spent months refining her presentation skills
Refining the algorithm improved its efficiency significantly

definitions: process of renovating and re-equipping a ship or building
replacement or updating of machinery, equipment, or systems
examples: The naval vessel underwent a complete refit
The refit included new engines and navigation systems
The factory refit modernized all production equipment
Building refit improved energy efficiency dramatically

definitions: image seen in a mirror or shiny surface
serious thought or consideration about something
thing that shows or represents the nature of something else
examples: Her reflection in the lake showed her worried expression
The mirror's reflection revealed the room behind him
After much reflection, she decided to change careers
The essay required deep reflection on personal values
Crime rates are a reflection of social conditions
His success was a reflection of years of hard work

definitions: device that reflects light, sound, or other waves
piece of glass or plastic that reflects light for visibility
examples: The telescope's reflector gathered distant starlight
Parabolic reflectors focus waves to a single point
Bicycle reflectors increase visibility at night
Highway reflectors guide drivers in fog and darkness

definitions: involuntary and immediate response to a stimulus
angle greater than 180 degrees but less than 360 degrees
examples: The doctor tested her knee reflex with a rubber hammer
Blinking is a protective reflex when objects approach eyes
The reflex angle measured 270 degrees
Students learned to identify reflex angles in geometry

definitions: grammatical form where subject and object refer to the same entity
done automatically without conscious thought or consideration
examples: The reflexive pronoun 'myself' refers back to the subject
Spanish has many reflexive verbs like 'levantarse'
His reflexive response saved him from injury
Checking her phone became a reflexive habit

definitions: process of planting trees in areas where forests were destroyed
environmental effort to restore forest ecosystems
examples: The reforestation project planted millions of native trees
Government reforestation programs combat climate change
Natural reforestation occurred after the fire
Reforestation efforts restored the watershed's health

definitions: action or process of making changes to improve a system or institution
amendment of conduct or removal of abuse or wrong
examples: Healthcare reform dominated the political agenda
Educational reform aimed to improve student outcomes
His reform came after years of criminal behavior
The program focuses on reform rather than punishment

definitions: 16th-century religious movement that led to Protestantism
act of reforming or state of being reformed
examples: The Reformation challenged Catholic Church authority
Martin Luther sparked the Protestant Reformation
The reformation of the justice system took decades
Personal reformation requires commitment and support

definitions: institution for detention and reformation of young offenders
place designed to reform rather than simply punish criminals
examples: The judge sent him to a reformatory instead of adult prison
The reformatory emphasized education and skill training
Victorian reformatories aimed to rehabilitate wayward children
The reformatory system replaced purely punitive approaches

definitions: person who works to change and improve society or institutions
advocate for political, social, or religious reform
examples: The education reformer proposed radical curriculum changes
Political reformers fought against corruption and inefficiency
Social reformers of the 1800s championed workers' rights
Religious reformers challenged traditional church practices

definitions: belief in gradual reform rather than revolution or radical change
political doctrine advocating reform within existing systems
examples: His reformism contrasted with revolutionary socialist ideas
Democratic reformism seeks change through electoral processes
Labor reformism improved conditions without system overthrow
The party adopted reformism over radical transformation

definitions: person who supports gradual reform rather than revolution
advocate of reformism as political or social strategy
examples: The reformist candidate promised incremental improvements
Reformist leaders worked within the existing system
Labor reformists negotiated better working conditions
Religious reformists sought to modernize ancient practices

definitions: change in direction of light passing between different mediums
deflection of any wave when passing through varying densities
examples: Light refraction makes objects appear bent in water
The lens uses refraction to focus light rays
Sound refraction in the atmosphere affects long-distance communication
Seismic wave refraction helps map Earth's interior

definitions: material able to withstand very high temperatures without melting
resistant to treatment or cure; stubborn or unmanageable
examples: The furnace was lined with refractory bricks
Refractory materials are essential in steel production
The refractory infection resisted multiple antibiotics
His refractory attitude made cooperation impossible

definitions: line or lines repeated at intervals in a poem or song
recurring section in music, especially the chorus
examples: The poem's refrain emphasized its central theme
Children quickly learned the catchy refrain
The song's refrain stuck in everyone's head
The refrain brought the audience together in singing

definitions: course reviewing material previously learned to maintain knowledge
something that helps restore or maintain skills or memory
examples: Nurses took annual refresher courses on emergency procedures
The driving refresher helped her regain confidence
The manual served as a refresher on company policies
A quick refresher reminded them of the meeting protocols

definitions: light food and drinks served as a snack
act of refreshing or state of being refreshed
examples: The conference provided refreshments during the break
Light refreshments will be served after the ceremony
The cool breeze brought refreshment from the heat
Mental refreshment came from the peaceful garden walk

definitions: substance used in refrigeration systems to absorb and release heat
chemical compound that undergoes phase transitions in cooling cycles
examples: The technician replaced the refrigerant in the air conditioner
Modern refrigerants have lower environmental impact
Ammonia served as an early industrial refrigerant
The refrigerant leak required immediate repair

definitions: process of cooling and maintaining low temperatures mechanically
method of preserving food and materials through cold temperatures
examples: Commercial refrigeration keeps produce fresh during transport
The refrigeration system failed during the power outage
Before refrigeration, people used ice houses and cellars
Proper refrigeration prevents bacterial growth in food
